channel.title: design on D00k
channel.description: Recent content in design on D00k

item.title: Time Twist Pop
item.description: Time Twist Pop is an simple, vibrant watchface design that aims to inject fun and colour into your day. With 9 different themes to choose from, you can easily switch up the look of the watchface to suit how you’re feeling. An ongoing project, Time Twist Pop is my first foray into working with C. Being a difficult language, especially for beginners, I intend to take my time to get it just right.

item.title: Extreme Web Optimizations, without Compromising Style
item.description: Over the past 10 months, I’ve worked on and off tweaking my site to get it closer to how I want it to look and perform. The main goal was simple: make a site that looks good, and loads fast. A quick solution would’ve been to keep the css to a minimum, use browser defaults for fonts etc. However that would’ve made my vision of a styled site difficult if not impossible.

item.title: Rebble Weather Icons
item.description: The task Inspired by the Pebble revival project, Rebble and their unique aesthetic inspired by the original series of icons developed by Heydays design for pebble, I set out to make my own weather icons to use in projects on the watches in the future. While I took inspiration to make them familiar to users, I also sought to give them their own flair and personality. The original Pebble icons, designed by Heydays.

item.title: adwaitapod
item.description: Adwaitapod is a modern and feature-rich theme for iPod Video models running Rockbox. The theme uses the principles of Gnome’s Adwaita design language, and aims to be a complete and pleasing experience for users. The music player screen. Features ∘ Consistent interface with rounded corners. ∘ Custom Lockscreen when the Hold switch is on in the main menu, or when USB is connected. ∘ Radio Player skin with station icon support when using an FM Presets file.

item.title: Colophon
item.description: A comprehensive dive into the design, creation and philosophy of this site. Site Philosophy This site exists to scratch an itch I’ve long had. Sharing stuff on social media has never been my mojo, I’ll often post my photography, however I yearned for something more expansive and interesting, so I made a website. The design of this site was made with one goal in mind: create vibrant a site that looks good and is fun to use, with the smallest file size possible.

item.title: Virtual Gallery
item.description: The Virtual Gallery a website was born in the summer of 2020 after the cancellation of an exhibition that an art course I was attending hosted. Not wanting the work and effort of everyone I did the course with to go to waste, I set out to make a platform for them to share with their friends and family. The Exhibition Work took several months to build a basic site from scratch using HTML and CSS, largely due to my inexperience however I learned a lot.

item.title: Origami Designs
item.description: Origami Modular Festive Tree The Origami festive tree is a modular origami tree with little slots in the leaves to put whatever you want! It was designed as a modular, flat-packable festive tree that could be practical, allowing you to put different decorations or items in it. The design still needs some tweaking before I’m happy with posting instructions, I’ll probably get around to it soon.

item.title: Famicase Exhibition
item.description: The Famicase Exhibition is an annual exhibition hosted by the Super Meteor store located in Tokyo, Japan. Entry is open to anyone worldwide, and the goal is create a cover for a fictional Famicom game of your creation. Famicase Exhibition 2021 entry - Become The 2021 Famicase Exhibition took place between April 29th and May 31st. ⬩ Famicase Website. ⬩ Purchase the Famicase 2021 Zine.
